Introduction
Why was this document written?
The OpenDNP3 library and testset is a portable, scalable, and rigorously tested implementation of the DNP3 stack written in C++ and provided by Green Energy Corp. to the community under the Apache 2.0 license. The library is optimized for massively parallel front end processor implementations and slave device simulations, although it has been verified to perform very well on embedded linux ARM architectures. It includes a command line master/slave test set.
This book was written for system implemeters who want to either use or modify the OpenDNP3 library. It explains the theory of operation behind the stack as well as details the application interfaces that are available.
Audience
The intended audience of this book are software developers who are (1) using the OpenDNP3 library with their proprietary applications or (2) modifying the OpenDNP3 library itself to add additional features or fix bugs. As such, a basic level of knowledge is presumed about the following topics: C++ and UML class and sequence diagrams.
New versions of this doc
The newest version of this document can be found alongside the latest source code of the OpenDNP3 library, available at the OpenDNP3 project webpage.
